meanings.definition: To strike the palms of the hands together with a sudden explosive sound
meanings.sent1: She claps her hands to show excitement.
meanings.sent2: The audience claps after the amazing magic trick.
meanings.sent3: The little girl claps happily when she sees her favorite cartoon.
meanings.sent4: The thunder claps loudly in the stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The teacher claps to get the students' attention.

meanings.definition: A sudden, explosive sound made by striking the palms of the hands together
meanings.sent1: The loud claps echoed in the empty room.
meanings.sent2: I heard claps coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected claps startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: The claps of thunder signaled the start of the storm.
meanings.sent5: The claps of applause filled the concert hall.

meanings.definition: A round of applause or approval, typically given at the end of a performance or speech
meanings.sent1: The actor received loud claps for his outstanding performance.
meanings.sent2: The claps of the audience showed their appreciation.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed and received imaginary claps from its owner.
meanings.sent4: The claps of approval resonated throughout the auditorium.
meanings.sent5: The claps of the crowd motivated the team to do their best.
